posts.title: Real world as Actor System
posts.text: One can partially model the real-world in an actor system.Like, imagine you, me, everyone and everything are actorsтАжThey act when they get a message in their mailboxтАжEvery actor runs in their process, doing their own businessтАжthey mostly do three things in their lifetime, listens to messages, changes his own view & perspective of the world purely based on the messages received, do things that they feel right.They may tell other actors to do something via messages or spawn more children actors and be a responsible parent. Not because they crave for a child, but to delegate their work to themтАж because the more the actors, the more resources they can utilizeтАжThe individual actors have no idea about the real world, and they donтАЩt share any memoryтАж if one dies, no one cares, except their parentsтАж Now imagine you are an actor and have a supervisor. Who supervises many other actors just like you;but you are a faulty one. You donтАЩt know how to center a text vertically in CSS. You can do three things at this point: Break down, and decide to leave your post, Ask a search engine (also an actor) to find resources to learn how to do the task so you can process the message.Optionally, by the time you take to learn the new skill, you could add the task to your mailbox again to do that in the future and keep doing other tasks.But that means you can reach a point when youтАЩre in a livelock [1] situationтАж what if the search engine failed to find any resource? YouтАЩre continuously reminding yourself about the task, not having enough sleep, and disrupting others needlesslyтАж why not just leave your post? Politely ask your supervisor by sending a message to terminate himself [0] In computation, spawning each of these actors takes nanoseconds and takes less than a KB of memory. Millions of actors get scheduled on an arbitrary number of physical CPU cores. You can create a strong hierarchy out of this. You have full control of how they would behave, their traits before they are even born out of that specification.Individually they have no significance. Actors can migrate one node to another, shout and listen to events/messages, spawn as many children they want, terminate them if they fail on their purpose and replace them with new ones in a matter of nanoseconds, even self terminate and clean out any footprint has left, with no moral obligations. Real-world is chaotic because we want to survive. Our mind is locked and protected by our aggressive behavior. We donтАЩt have an agreed protocol to communicate, a common goal to achieve, a messed up hierarchy, reluctant to gracefully migrate to a different place, and damn.! ainтАЩt we have too many globals to deal with? not a single source of truth.., no CRDTтАж oopsie ЁЯЩГ [0]: donтАЩt in real life[1]: a condition in which two or more threads while not blocked cannot make further progress

posts.title: fighting with zalgo spam
posts.text: In short, zalgo text: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6579844/how-does-zalgo-text-workextra: http://archives.miloush.net/michkap/archive/2010/04/28/10002896.html the problem: is in the thumbnail there might be many solution, but none of them really works all the time. just removing diacritics or combine characters wonтАЩt solve the problem. and striping or Modifying user submitted text should have strong reasons. this is not one of them. imagine if Stack overflow sanitized the content of that question, OP would have to submit a screenshot to describe the thing solution: 1234p, span, .whatever { display: block; // overflow: hidden won't work otherwise overflow: hidden;} set line-height as needed, as much you want to be visible and also you may want to set overflow: visible on :hover now, let pips do whatever they want.. like using username/handle: р╕кр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зр╣Зaudacioustuxр╕к

posts.title: library-less node config & secrets management
posts.text: use bash script; instead of dotenv dependencymake ./bin/export.sh with: 12345678910#!/usr/bin/env bashDOT_ENV="$1"EXEC=${@:2}set -asource $DOT_ENVset +a$EXEC now to use this with nodemon: 12345678910111213141516171819{ "delay": 0, "verbose": true, "watch": [ "src" ], "ignore": [ "**/*.spec.ts", "**/*.test.ts", ".git", "**/node_modules" ], "env": { "nodemon": 1, "DEBUG": "*" }, "exec": "npm run build && ./bin/export.sh .env npm start", "ext": "js,json,ts"} ignore other attributes. see how ./bin/export.sh .env is used in exec value. but, donтАЩt forget to chmod +x ./bin/export.sh this only works on linux (& probably on mac) not recommended for use with docker. you would use docker/k8s secrets or other methods anyway ┬п\(уГД)/┬п use centralized config file; instead of node-config dependency1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071import crypto from 'crypto';const { NODE_ENV = 'production' } = process.env;const isDev = NODE_ENV === 'development';// safe for all environmentconst safeDefs: NodeJS.ProcessEnv = { PORT: '4000',};// safe defaults for production environmentconst prodDefs: NodeJS.ProcessEnv = { ...safeDefs };// safe defaults for development environmentconst devDefs: NodeJS.ProcessEnv = { ...safeDefs, REDIS_CONNECTION_STRING: 'redis://redis', PG_CONNECTION_STRING: 'postgres://postgres:password@postgres/nobinalo', ES_NODE: 'http://elasticsearch:9200', EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SECRET: crypto.randomBytes(48).toString('base64'), PHONE_NO_VERIFICATION_SECRET: crypto.randomBytes(48).toString('base64'), AUTH_JWT_SECRET: crypto.randomBytes(33).toString('base64'),};const env = new Proxy(process.env, { get: (env, key: string): string => { const value = env[key]; const devValue = devDefs[key]; const prodValue = prodDefs[key]; if (value) return value; if (isDev && devValue) return devValue; if (!isDev && prodValue) return prodValue; throw new Error(`Environment Variable '${key}' is missing!`); },}) as Record<string, string>;const { PG_CONNECTION_STRING, REDIS_CONNECTION_STRING, SENDGRID_API_KEY, PORT, EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SECRET, PHONE_NO_VERIFICATION_SECRET, AUTH_JWT_SECRET, ES_NODE,} = env;const config = { isDev, NODE_ENV, SECRETS: { EMAIL_VERIFICATION_SECRET, PHONE_NO_VERIFICATION_SECRET, AUTH_JWT_SECRET, }, PORT, knex: { connection: PG_CONNECTION_STRING, }, redis: { REDIS_CONNECTION_STRING }, elasticsearch: { node: ES_NODE, }, sendgrid: { SENDGRID_API_KEY, },};export default config; usage: 12345import config from '../config';const { redis: { REDIS_CONNECTION_STRING },} = config; this will, fail in production mode use тАШredis://redisтАЩ in development mode if REDIS_CONNECTION_STRING env variable is not set.

posts.title: swap, zram, zswap, random linux stuffs
posts.text: context: Linux Bangladesh facebook group swap, swapfile, zswap, zramрж░тАНрзНржпрж╛ржо ржпрждржЗ рж╣рзЛржХ, almost-always-add-swap-space - https://haydenjames.io/linux-performance-almost-always-add-swap-space/ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХржд GB? hibernate (suspend on disk) ржлрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ ржЪрж╛ржЗрж▓рзЗ рж░тАНрзНржпрж╛ржорзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржЗржЬ + рзз ржЬрж┐ржмрж┐ ржпржжрж┐ рж╣рж╛ржЗржмрж╛рж░ржирзЗржЯ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ ржнрж╛ржмржирж╛ ржирж╛ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ: hdd рж╣ржЗрж▓рзЗ: ржжрж░ржХрж╛рж░ ржирж╛ржЗ (ржкрж░рзЗ ржХрж╛рж╣рж┐ржирзА ржЦрзБрж▓рзЗ ржмрж▓рждрзЗржЫрж┐) ssd рж╣ржЗрж▓рзЗ: 1 GB ржХрзНржпрж╛ржоржирзЗ ржмрж╛ржирж╛ржмрзЛ?12345$ sudo su$ dd if=/dev/zero of=/swapfile1 bs=1G count=<swap_size>$ chown root:root /swapfile1; chmod 0600 /swapfile1$ mkswap /swapfile1; swapon /swapfile1$ echo "/swapfile1 none swap sw 0 0" >> /etc/fstab explanation: 1) switch to root user, 2) рж╣рж┐ржЙржЬ ржПржХржЦрж╛ржи ржлрж╛ржЗрж▓, ржпрж╛рждрзЗ ржХрзЛржирзЛ рж╣рзЛрж▓ ржирж╛ржЗ -_- replace <swap_size> with ржпржд ржЬрж┐ржмрж┐ рж╕рзЛрзЯрж╛ржк ржЪрж╛ржи (ex: 1,2,3тАж) 3) set permission for the file 4) file ржЯрж╛ржХрзЗ рж╕рзЛрзЯрж╛ржк рж╣рж┐рж╕рж╛ржмрзЗ ржмрзНржпржмрж╣рж╛рж░ ржЙржкржпрзЛржЧрзА ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржпрзЗ 5) swapfile ржЯрж╛ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐ рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░рзНржЯрж╛ржкрзЗ ржЕржЯрзЛржорзНржпрж╛ржЯрж┐ржХрж╛рж▓рж┐ рж╕рзЛрзЯрж╛ржк рж╣рж┐рж╕рж╛ржмрзЗ ржорж╛ржЙржирзНржЯ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржпрзЗтАж zswap, zram ржХрж┐рждрж╛?рж╕рзЛрзЯрж╛ржк ржЖрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржХрж┐ рж╣рзЯ? hdd/ssd рж░тАНрзНржпрж╛ржорзЗрж░ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржЕржирзЗржХржЯрж╛ рж╕рзНрж▓рзЛред рж╣рж╛рж░рзНржбрж▓рж┐ ржПржнрж╛рж░ ржЗржЙржЬрзНржб ржорж╛ржирзЗрждрзЛ ржПржЗ ржирж╛ ржпрзЗ ржХржЦржирзЛржЗ ржмрзНржпржмрж╣рж╛рж░ рж╣ржмрзЗржирж╛?
